content:
Posted: October 20, 2015
												I have been cheking on this game for a while. Then I bought it on a sale.. And after like half an hour of playing I realized that I have found something I have been looking for for many years.Remember Alien Swarm, Alien Breed, etc.? Ever felt like it would be nice to just shoot monsters in a sci-fi NON FPS setting? Have some co-op fun with friends or strangers?Well this is the answer.I have not played the spiritual predecessors. But man! It took me hours of playing and some reading to find out that this game is brilliant. A big map with lots of different enemies, loot, skills, character customization, quests, mini quests.. and all put together in a fitting frame. And at last it is challenging enough to keep you playing.Did I mention optional bots, followers, side quests, different game modes?TBH I expected less than half that it offers, and I could have settled for even less. I am still kinda surprised.Did I mention bosses? Or legendary item drops?Point is that there is everything you ever wanted or found out for a game like this. And a lot more.Did I mention they are just testing to add a new weapon for more cutomization? And that there are more maps than I care to try. I didn't even expect to play on more than one since it is like a sandbox frame, the replayability is already there with that one single map.There is only one downside.. not too many people. I manage to get full groups going in a few mins but still. Good thing it is fun to play with 2-3 ppl as well;) [Did I mention co-op Bots?]It is the very best there is in the genre. If you are into this kind of game so much to♥♥♥♥♥♥yourself to read my review than you really should do yourself the favor and buy it.Did I mention that the community is strangely enough pretty good, and the learning curve is very rewarding even if you die a few times early in the game first?10/10 Have not seen anything near as good as this game since C64 that is comparable in terms of gameplay.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 8, 2015
												Since there are plenty reviews explain game's mechanic, I'll try to keep this short. Overall, TRS is a solid top down tactical survial shooting game. Due to the "tactical" element and a steep learning curve, the best gaming experience you get from this game is the fruition of the ability to cooperate, adapt, follow and understand the "order" of the team leader (experienced vet).TRS is quiet unforgiving for rookies, so the willingness to learn and stick with the game is a necessity. In order to prevent the unfair random-kicking in multiplayer mode and the risk of losing game due to the lack of knowledge on game's mechanic, I wholeheartedly recommend everyone (intent to play---casually playing----intent to be a pro):-Try the single player mode (for the tutorial mainly). It has a pretty good storyline.-Read those "Everything" guides by Bonzai101, Valore and Grizzly. (You're gonna be surprised by the amount of knowledge you may learn/miss out). Check out those in-depths about classes and game mechanics (leadership).-Get TeamSpeak (an app similar to RaidCall). "Why", you asked? Well, the best way to learn a game is by playing it. And it's good to have somebody with experience to explain/help through the preparation and ingame if you decide to skip reading the guides. Mic is not required, vet only need you to listen and understand.The code to the TRS community server is: ts.com-game.de+ Inevitably, there are good and bad players. Some will assist you, some just downright ignore or troll you to oblivion; but the majority of the player base will help you with welcome arms.-One last thing, invite your friend or introduce it to somebody closed to you. The biggest problem with TRS right now is lack of player. The community is too small at the moment.Well, That's all I have to say. I mostly play as Heavy Support, never get around to learn being a leader, cuz i enjoy being a slow♥♥♥♥♥supportive follower using a minigun to slow♥♥♥♥♥♥down and let people do the rest. And I'm still pretty "new"to the game, despite 100+ hrs clock-in.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 16, 2015
												The Red Solstice is a top down, strategy shooter that plays like a blend of quality custom Starcraft 2 maps and Alien Swarm. It pits you and up to 7 other Human controlled marines against hordes of the monstrosities created by the STROL virus. To survive and complete your objective you must work with your teamates,scavenging materials, making plans for the hectic closing moments of a match, and dispatching the various dangers you will encounter during your stay at Tharsis colony. A Typical match of The Red Solstice can last around an hour, so do not expect the typical drop in drop out style multiplayer that many games today utilize. keep this in mind when you put aside time to play the game.I would like to mention that this game is hard, and can be incredibly brutal at times. Excpect to die quite often as a new player, so don't feel put off by it, it happens to everyone. Despite the difficulty, failure still nets class and account experience for you rendering even a loss into meaningful progress of both in game XP as well as real life player skill. To help alleviate the difficulty for newcomers, a certain ammount of free automatic respawns are granted to players below a certain rank. Additionally, players seeking assistance can ask both the developers and the community for advice as this game has some of the most active devs and most helpful community members of any game I have ever played. The community has also prepared a variety of guides that cover almost every aspect of the game with an incredible ammount of detail, I highly recommend new players look over these.In conclusion, The Red Solstice is a very unique, and very fun game. It offers a large ammount of replayabillity in the multiplayer modes and a good ammount of content aimed at those who prefer single player activities. I wholeheartedly recommend this game to anyone willing to give it the modicum of patience required to learn its particular nuances.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 22, 2015
												Review Edit.So Red Solstice what is it? It's a top down against all odds genre. Think Alien Swarm with RPG mechanics thrown into it. You get some pretty interesting "Weapons and class's to choose from"And the skills seem to have a designed sense of purpose not like alot of other games where you mash the keyboard when hell breaks lose and somehow you survive.This game isnt that game you need to choose your kit wisely, and you also need to get familiar with the levels, tactics and your class what limitations are in place for each class and weapon to have a successful outcome.The game is has a learning curve, but once you pick up the basics it keeps you locked in for a many hours. You do however want to be aware that since this game doesn't seem to have a huge following yet it is recommended you have friends play with you or buy the game as to be honest you can spend a bit of time waiting for matches.But if you're like me and you have some note worthy friends who enjoy dying often then yes this game is for you.Is it worth 20$ i'd have to yes they update often and they developers stay true to the concept and are constantly balancing and tweaking various game mechanics to keep the game fun. Also they have some pretty interesting holiday events like SANTACLAWS?.

number of helpful: 4 of 8 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 30, 2016
												An offspring of the original NOTD:AM,SO,SWAT game in Warcraft 3. The Red Solstice is an 8 player tactical, co-op objective based top down shooter. You are one of the black ops unit send in to Mars to investigate and contain a virus outbreak. You'll be pitted against hordes of infected on a desolate planet scouring for ammo, weapons, medical supplies while racing against time to complete your mission objectives and boss fights.The game features a variety of combat classes to choose from such as assault, heavy support, recon, demolition, medic, terminator, marksman & hellfire. Players are able to level up their classes to gain additional skills & stats as they progress further into the game. If you're a fan of Alien Swarm or NOTD get this game. Word of warning though this game is extremely challenging and requires quite a bit of strategic planning and teamwork if you wish to survive.

number of helpful: 6 of 12 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 30, 2016
												Personally I really enjoy this game when playing with a group of serious players on the hardest difficulty.Is this game for you?To really enjoy this game, you need to be a team player. When you start playing, you need to listen to more experienced people and learn from them. This is not a game for you to run around trying to be a hero, you will die, and get people killed.This game does have lots of little tips and tricks you learn that are the difference between clutching a victory on Soldier difficulty (2/4) and breezing a a win on Aetriden difficulty(4/4). The people running around in circles on autofire are the ones doomed to soldier forever, then they get made at the game for requiring they actually learn something to win.The game is somewhat repetative, there are 6 maps, ranging in difficultly and layout, with more planned as free content expansions, none of this paid dlc stuff. There are two primary storylines that can spawn, and a dozen or so secondary missions that spawn randomly through out each play through, certain secondaries are locked until your are in a group that is higher rank as they are more difficult, such as the Eye of the Storm mission. However the replayability comes from this random element, as well as trying to beat the game's current most difficult map, Military sector on Aetriden difficulty, which has currently only been beaten once!Some people complain about the 'toxic' community on this game, well I believe I am one of those 'toxic' players apparently, because I require people in my games to be on teamspeak. The reason for this is simple, I play higher difficulty games and there is no time to type everything I need to tell you through out the game. Winning Veteran+ difficulty is extremely unlikely when not on teamspeak because not being able to hear the leaders instructions leads to small mistakes, which lead to deaths. As for the moderation of TS, I've seen 1 ban in the last 2 months, and that was someone trying to be disruptive and harassing the community.The game has a few problems, desync is an issue sometimes, there are some other glitches too, however the developers are highly active within the community, to the point one is online on teamspeak almost every day listening to feedback, and if anyone is having any issues. Some bugs were creating in recent patches, and fixed almost immediately. Others have been around longer but are much more complicated issues that are hard to fix without breaking everything around it, or are inconsistent and difficult to replicate and pinpoint.All in all, I'd give TRS an 8/10 as it stands right now, and that's trying to be highly critical of it. Most games I see coming out would be lucky to reach 6+. However, this game is not worth you buying it if you don't want to invest time and effort into learning it and getting good, you'll just end up out of pocket, upset and writing a bad review here or being an actual toxic player within the community. If you are willing to invest into this game however, endless hours of sweat, tears and laughter await you, just beware the levi in the bush!

content:
Posted: August 21, 2014
Early Access Review
								*****ALERT! THIS USER IS NOT A ENGLISH SPEAKER! SORRY FOR ANY BAD ENGLISH*****There is no attribute points or skill points that you can spend if you "level up" in this game. The game is more likely a sci-fri version of LOL (league of legends) with a lot fewer heros. Well, you can spend your "skill points" in every round, but will be reset when round ended.  (THOUGH YOU CAN GET A PERMANENT "RANK UP" WHEN YOU GOT ENOUGH EXP, BUT IT ONLY INCREASE YOUR HP, SPEED,ETC. WHICH ARE FIXED.)And it doesn't like any rpg which by killing some random npc, you can get some loots. In this game, the statistic, the weapons, the armor, etc are fixed. That means that all player get the same look, same weapon, same stat, etc if  they choose the same class in the same level. I was expecting the game was at least similar to the DOW 2. (Warhammer 40k: DAWN OF WAR2)If you are expecting the game was similar to DIABLO with future weapon or Alien Swarm, just like what I thought, don't buy this game, and you will find it totally different. I come from Hong Kong and I find it is very difficult to find a server. The server room is always empty. If you are lucky, you may find a room, but in most case, I got kicked because my character's level is too low. And my character's level is low because I cannot find a room....... What is more, if you don't have many friends, like me, don't buy this game yet, save your money.This game may get better in the future, but I wouldn't recomend to buy it at this stage.(2014/8/21)

content:
Posted: July 17, 2014
Early Access Review
								This game, is truelly amazing! It involves a lot of teamplay and skill, however it may not look like it at first sight.The game is about a marine squad that's exploring a planet, Mars (The Red Planet). And there they find out that there's an infestation going on, which probably is caused by a failed experiment, or succeeded one? Who knows?You are in a team of up to 8 marines, trying to stop it, by either doing, missions, which are divided in a primary questline, and side quests. There are lots of waves, each wave obviously is stronger. You might just as well die, or run out of ammo? For that not to happen, you must also loot a little, since you can loot buildings etc, for ammo, medkits, and other random supplies. When you don't think you can survive any longer, you can get an evac, from on a certain wave (The wave at which it gets available is different for each difficulty). The evac is an item you can find on the map, and when you've got it you can activate it to evacuate, then you'll have to protect the person who activated it for 2 minutes, (he/she can move). When the 2 minutes are over the Dropship comes in for evacuation after another minute, but then you'll no longer have to protect the person who was calling the evac. I hope this review is helpfulish.... SIdenote: This is more a summary really....

												ignore the bitterness from the peanut gallery. some were warned several times on the forums that personal attacks is not going to be tolerated and still went for it earning themselves a ban. look past the salt and find a game with a lot of flaws but if you manage to look past them you can have hundreds of hours of fun.we have several new players that has recently found this game and enjoy it.we have a ts channel that you can hang out in even though the game might seem dead at at times but groups form there all the time.now to the game itself.if you played warcraft/starcraft custom games its taken its inspiration from there.its a hardcore hordemode game with a high skill and tactic requirement for higher difficulties.or its a fun gorefest for newer players on lower difficulties.bear in mind that this is a hardcore niche game and if you dont want to spend 20$ wait for free weekend/sale to grab or try the game.

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 27, 2015
												Red Solstice is a game that encourages grinding and memorization of map objectives (and it does this even over teamwork) in order to succeed.Typical games result in 1k - 2k experience for your selected class, and it takes about 10-20k experience to gain one rank in the suit (1% speed, critical rating, that sort of thing). Considering the number of classes there are and there are like 10 ranks in each suit, that is a lot of grinding.Victory leads to 5k - 6k experience but if you're a new player that will come to you few and far between. And being that each game typically consumes 40 minutes or more, it will still take a considerable amount of time to max out the suit of your preference.Red Solstice CAN be fun, but the combat tends to be a little bit less entertaining than I was hoping for. I play with auto-targeting for the most part and that actually takes a lot of the fun out of the genre, but necessary, because manual targeting isn't effective enough to take out the swarming armies the AI decides to throw at you.Game has a tiny community, average at best. Multiiplayer games can take some time to fill (for a newish game).Art can be hit or miss (portraits). No major complaints, but there isn't enough emphasis on the "cool" element of manning state-of-the-art space marine body armor running around gunning or torching down alien zombies. I don't "feel" it. Far fetched hope that this will be fixed.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 8, 2016
												This is a squad based tactical game that is for a new player difficult to master. Get ready to die a lot while playing because it's extremely easy to die.  The nice thing is that when you finally beat this game you will feel a real sense of accomplishment.  Currently there aren't really that many players playing.  However if you have some patience and do get to jump into a game, you will play with some really great people.  Many of my friends list people are from this game.This game doesn't require a high APM at all. As I said earlier this is a team tactical game where each class contributes to the overall survival of your group.  Although if you do have a high APM the game will be easier to pick up.  I have personally been playing this game for over 2 years with (currently) about 700 hours played.  This has been my go to game for entertainment whenever I don't know what to play.  Each and every game is different from the last since you there are multiple game modes to play on with different maps.  Difficulties also change up the gameplay as well.  Many different classes to play that all do completely different things and plays different roles. Here's my latest gameplay video:


YouTube™ Video: The Red Solstice - Aetriden Run 

			Views: 91		

			Here we run Aetriden difficulty in Transport Map. I don't really know this map too well so I don't take too many risks.

content:
Posted: August 2, 2016
												Having fixed my issue (related it seems to nVidia Optimus -- turned off, and now I can more reliably get into the game), I would recommend this game, though still with some reservations, as it is pretty buggy.The game, when running properly, is enjoyable, has a good skill tree, good balance of planning, strategy, and tactics.The game is also very challenging.  Playing Survival or Multiplayer maps, you can expect to lose, over and over again.  Team play is very important, and it takes a while to get the hang of proper tactics and skill usage.(As of August 2016)  The community is pretty tolerant, so when starting out in Multiplayer, just listen to the leader, follow the lines drawn, and (try to) fill your role, and you'll eventually get the hang of it.There do remain a number of detriments to the game, however.  In Survival (and in Multiplayer, if not filling a team with real people), you control one character, and can swap between characters.  For some reason, the key mapping for swapping and issuing commands is different between the single player storyline (where it starts with a basic tutorial of how to manage this) than it is from Survival/Multi.  Also, you can issue commands to multiple characters to carry out concurrently, just don't be surprised when the character you aren't currently swapped into decides to just wander off or stop halfway through his queued command.In addition, there are quite a few latency/sync bugs in multiplayer.  Be prepared to encounter unkillable enemies when what you're firing at isn't in sync with the server (though, of course, they can still damage you).  Also, skills sometimes just don't take effect.  (This bug I've noticed most with the Medic, which is pretty sucky, when you need health or to remove an ailment, and you simply can't.)So, if you can bear the (more than) occasional frustrations, or just plan to play through the single player campaign (which is good), then I would recommend this game.[Obsolete - Fixed now, in my case]However, the bulk of the game is Submit Crash Report.  It started that I would have to do multiple attempts to load the game, submitting 2 crash reports before finally getting in on the 3rd try.  That eventually degraded, to 4 or more attempts, and occasional reboots to get it working.After Windows 10 build update (from 8/2/2016), the game is more unstable than ever.  Before, once *finally* in, I could at least play.  Now that's not a given.  Enemies will sometimes render incorrectly, the game will sometimes crash out.[Obsolete - Fixed now, in my case]Since you have to grind XP to improve your characters, it becomes especially frustrating, as this means your reward for doing well is stolen XP and getting to look at your desktop again...

content:
Posted: August 11, 2014
Early Access Review
								You move by right-clicking on the spot, you left-click to attack, and it has an "auto-fire" option which will shoot at enemies automatically, with a small penalty.No campaign, no lobbies (so far, at least) leveling system seems to be circumventable by picking a different class. -BTW, no real way to make apparent that you CAN switch suits-I had to play the intro mission twice before I could realize that, no, the mission hadn't crashed and yes, I had beaten the mission.While I understand that the game is pre-release, I simply don't like the mechanics. I guess I was hoping for something closer to Alien Swarm, instead of a passive "place marine here".I feel that taking control away from the player to this degree on tactical and survival missions works against the idea. It might make the game more stable, but it also makes it mroe boring.Overall, it felt like a waste of money.

content:
Posted: July 9, 2015
												I know that negative reviews are unpopular and it seems like everyone really likes this title a lot; but I just didn't have a very good time playing The Red Solstice. It looks really good graphics-wise, sounds great and has a lot of classes/weapons to choose from but the multiplayer campaign was just too long for me and I just didn't feel any connection to what my character was doing on the screen. When I died it was due to friendly fire (are you kidding me) and I had to sit the entire rest of the round out until everyone else wiped. This game absolutely is geared towards gamers that are big into long, technical campaigns and that is totally cool it has it's place I just don't think it's for everyone.It's still very much a pre-release title and maybe with some proper balancing and tweaks it could be more fun.I was provided press access to The Red Solstice and was not compensated any other way for my review. My opinions are my own.

content:
Posted: July 12, 2014
Early Access Review
								Where to start?Yes it's Beta, yes it's rough around the edges. It crashes every once in a while, the matchmaker is currently a tad instable but the developers made a game you want to play anyways.Like the Warhammer 40k feeling? Like Space Marines or "Starship Troopers"? Like a challenging game? Like Teamplay? Remember Alien Swarm, Alien Breed or Space Siege?Then TRS is most likely for you.You:- get to choose from various classes and can save loadouts.- gain character and class experience.- you unlock classes, boosts, weapons and skills with your class level.- can take a few skills, a few boosts and various primary and secondary weapons with you on the battlefield.- loot tons of stuff on the map from barricades to nukes.- currently choose from multiple game settings, doing missions or bunker (defending a beacon) or mix it.- can command your squad with easy map commands.- die. mostly. either because the guy next to you felt it necessary to run with 10 ammo crates and watch you die out of ammo, or because you get blown up by team mates, or better yet, they deploy their drop-pods right on you :DOne note: There's no WSAD movement. It's click'n'run.At first it felt odd, but once you got your awesome dude running you got to switch weapons and firing modes, throw flares, use your skills, drop satchels and blow them and whatnot. After some hours on the clock I feel it was a good choise not to use WSAD. It lets you focus on the important stuff.YMMV.

content:
Posted: September 25, 2015
												The Red Solstice struggles to make multiplayer reliably fun. The objectives are strung along to frustrate players into hoping they have enough gear, ammo, and patience to withstand a non-negotiable 45 minute bullet spam session. While a nearly hour long bullet frenzy is usually the hallmark of excellence in a tactical isometric view shooter, The Red Solstace does not cater to objective based play styles.Each objective is given with a real world time frame, which enhances a strong narrative. Sadly the game does not support those players who head directly to each objective and accomplishes each task as the game asked. It is a game for a generation of video gamer who get distracted by shiny new things, who want to clear the entire map before moving to the next waypoint, and who don't care that the waves of monsters increase in difficulty as the time dwindles.The Red Solstace becomes just another mindless shooter that ignores the very cool world that it tries to setup at the beginning of each mission. Run, shoot, survive should be the tagline - but instead it is more like meander, shoot, constantly fail because ♥♥♥♥ you. It does not care about how good a player is or how effectively and quickly a player may finish what the game asked it to do because it has another agenda as a moody shooter that wants to make a tactical horror shooter with scarce resources (while providing WAY too many resources).The Red Solstace doesn't know what it wants to be. It struggles to be a game while also failing to provide an immersive story experience. It has a genuinely great random mission generation system that is a thin veneer of reasons to drag players across each map and hope they die later with each play through. The Red Solstace is, ultimately, a very well polished frustration engine that just wants your $20 and a few hours of your time so you can infect your friends' Steam Libraries with this awful piece of♥♥♥♥♥♥

content:
Posted: July 14, 2015
												This game was okay, but that's all it was. It wasn't excellent nor was it bad, but the reason I wouldn't recommend this game is because I have already played this. On Starcraft 2. This game is based on The Rising Dead custom map from the arcade section on the popular RTS, but like the game its based on -- the same problem persists: low player base. Not only that, but this felt like a reiteration of the game on a different engine, standalone, with a singleplayer campaign and a few nifty things added. There is the vision concept where its harder to shoot in the dark which is neat. The manual aiming was also neat with the bonus damage it gave, but was a little iffy in that you had to aim a little bit more up to compensate for the slightly angled top-down view.Sadly, these things aren't enough to distinguish itself as a separate game, and in all honesty, I would rather refund this game and play the Starcraft 2 version where the character movements aren't as stiff.

								This game has been a huge surprise for me.I am a huge fan of cooperative games, i bought this game during early access because it looked promising.I forgot about it until was fully released and this has been a blast.-It has a strong Space meuhrins feel.-many classes that all contribute to victory in their own way, and they are fairly balanced.-The game seemed simple at first but it is actually incredibly deep, one of the deepest coop game i know of.-The Ai is unforgiving and you will get a good challenge even on normal difficulty.-It has many skill to choose from for each class and kind of a dota way of leveling up.-You get 15 level max while you are playing and you have to attribute point carefully in each of your 4 skills with 5 points max in each, some are passive some are active, and hallow you to play exactly the way you want.-The online is one of the best i know of, most people are friendly and most veteran will not mind giving you some advice.In 50 hours of gameplay i have yet to find any troll.The only downside i can see is that the game can seem overwhelming at first, the learning curve is steep and the RTS view will not be to everyone's liking, except that it is a masterpiece and i strongly recommend this game.

http://steamcharts.com/app/265590The game has single player modes now so at least you can enjoy the game somewhat when you cant find anyone online playing. Which sadly is more then half the time for me, despite the fact that the game launched this month. At least click the steam chart above and get an idea of what you are getting into. The game can be fun, but unless the community grows I just could not recomend it, I am hopefull though. In a side note, I came back to play this for a few hours last week after playing a game called helldivers that weekend. And ultimatly asked myself if the potential of the red solstice outweighed the amazing, and fun filled hours I had playing HellDivers. And the games are similar enough to me that less then a minute into this question I uninstalled TRS. I would like to say I might come back one day but the sad reality is. I found another game that scratches the same itch this one does, only better, is alot more fun for me, is 5 bucks cheaper, and I think has more potential...either way its a hell of alot more fun. I wish the devs and the small community well though, I think you guys are going to need it.

content:
Posted: July 22, 2015
												It may not be the prettiest/best sounding/polished game out there, but it is still one of my favorite games that I have played and will most likely continue playing it for some time. Most games these days lack depth, difficulty, and other elements that exist in The Red Solstice, which is what I’m looking for in games.While the survival mode of the game is fun to play over and over, the single player story mode campaign needs some work. As I played through it, it felt like the developers kept getting lazier and lazier with the level designs, and it didn’t help that it was comprised of repurposed survival mode maps. The main thing that I didn’t like was that most levels had equipment and weapons hidden in areas that would unlock them for future missions, and while looking for and finding them were fun, the design of maps didn’t work well for this. Many maps were too big and, while most areas were zoned off so you couldn’t explore the entirety of large maps, some weren’t blocked off so I didn’t know if it was a mistake or I should waste hours going around and searching every single building since there might be something in one of them. There are no indicators of whether you’ve found everything in a map, so you either have to look it up online somewhere or search every mission over and over until you find everything.Another thing that I would like to see getting some polish is making the AI characters do more than just follow you around. It is nice to completely control them, but at the same time they need to be able to do more on their own than just follow you and shoot. Sometimes they won’t even shoot at enemies, especially when you tell them to go pick up and item or do something else.Video of some gameplay:

content:
Posted: July 24, 2015
												The Dark Souls of co-op gamesBut on a serious note this game is a difficult co-op of up to 8 players with a single player campaign to it also.  The Red Solstice has a steep learning curve for new players, and there is also a bit of a grind when coming to ranking up which essentially is just giving you a bonus to stats each time.  This game rewards good teamwork and punishes mercilessly bad teamwork.  They're plenty of in depth guides for new players and the community is pretty helpful in breaking you into the game.  I would advise having a teamspeak or something similar even if its just to listen due to the fast pace of this game.  You may notice at times desynch and bugs not gona lie it's nothing game breaking but it's defently noticable especially if you join a high ping host.  The player base has been revived so finding a match with others isn't nearly as hard plus it's got a single player now so waiting isn't really much of a problem anymore thankfully. That's not to say the playerbase won't leave in the future but for now it's doing well.As for gameplay this game features 8 different classes each with their own unique abilities, strengths, and weaknesses. During the gameplay you gain energy which can power these different abilites making them more potent or unlocking new ones.  Six different maps to choose from and a myriad of different monsters and bosses all eagerly awaiting to chew your face off.  They're 4 diifferent main difficulties from Recruit to Aetridan with 8 different sub difficutlies to add with it. The objective of the co-op aspect is to survive 15 waves of hellish creatures all the while doing objectives and scavenging for items to use. At the end of the last wave you are to complete the last objective and then evac to the a certain point of the map, on average a game winning match will last around an hour.  So would i recommend this game... hell yes i would.   I had a great time with it and if you're willing to work with people it's one of the most rewarding experiences beating the game with others

Early Access Review
								This game has a lot of potential.... that being said it is extremely buggy currently. I get crashes trying to join  a game lobby, crashes on game start, crashes mid game, crashes at game end.... crashing all over the place.There are numerous other minor issues (class re-set when another player joins a game with your current class for example) and I would be willing to bet there are other problems that are unapparent.The mission tracking feature is confusing and it is difficult to understand what the current goal of team is. This is incredibly important in a game that hinges on team work.  This needs to be obvious or more user friendly.It is still a fairly fun experience though but I can't recommend it with out knowing if the developers are going to improve the game.

content:
Posted: January 22
												Artificially made diffult with overwelming odds with the necessity to destroy "tunnels" with specific weaponry that is rare.  These "tunnels" are where mobs spawn from - but no matter if there is only 2 left or all of them - the number of mobs coming at you is always increasing and it is endless (no joke ENDLESS).   One would think if 90% of the "tunnels" are down - there should be a lot less mobs coming at you.Artifically made difficult so they can say 30 hour campaign? Not much strategy as there is only 1 way to get to your objectives - a pre scripted path.  Can''t easily use explosive weapons as the mobs are point blank hitting you and your explosions will kill your own men.On mission 2 i can't get beyond this a set of barricades that is swarming - even after 30 checkpoint restarts (and after 10 - you have to start the mission all over again - with the same dry scripted openings each mission.). A lot more fun / non frustrating games out there.

number of helpful: 21 of 45 people (47%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 14, 2014
Early Access Review
								For the moment i can't recommand this game for everybody.Because...Instead of my last review [watch at the end of this one], i've won a game !This is amazing how good it is. Especially if you loose around 20 times before it ^^In fact the mission was different and, in my humble point of view, much better !All the team was droped from a space ship near a beacon.It must be protected until the end of a certain amount of enemy's waves.The beacon drops some supplies to help you in the battle, like sentry turrets, ammo and sand bags.All the difficulty was to build the defenses, set up traps, protect sentries and for me, keep the other guys alive until the end of days that came on us. And we made it ! I was a Medic as usual. After so much failures, i could start to upgrade my character.The upgrade system is really cool, for each class you have a rank and defines how long you played this class, so the higher the better...Skills wich increase with levels: at the beginning too few, but with few levels... oh my ! That's so good to place a resurecting beacon during a hellish mission ! You can even call orbital drops to give stuff to your comrades or activate buffs to the whole team.You have new weapons in two different types: primary and secondary. The primary weapons really changes your way to engage, as a Medic i can choose at high rank a sniper rifle, the basic weapon is a weak assault rifle. The secondary give you some shotguns and explosivs weapons like a rotary grenade launcher,ect.. Weapons are different between each classe. Medic: assault rifles. Demolisher: explosivs. Recon: smg. Heavy: minigun, ect...Your armor can be upgraded with 4 slots to receive some "perks". A bit complicate to use because each perks increase a statistic of the character but reduce an other one. You want to run faster ?allright but you will have less damages done... quite nasty :'(All of that is not too much to prepare yourself for the fire of the action.And this is really tought !As i said before you gonna die a lot. But winning is very rewarding. Like some few rares games like Arma or Dark Soul. Enemies are quite numerous and very violent. Every creature has stats (you can see them when you hover your mouse on them). The special events happens quite often, and a good planning is really rewarding, like using explosivs to make chain reactions and take down a boss or a huge horde of creature in one blow. But when your team is splitting... in general you won't stand a chance.Every classes needs skills to be mastered.As a Medic i needed quite some time to understand how to get exp correctly (missions or the most common slaving monsters to get xp). Xp give you the opportunity to increase the level of the skills you have choosen (you can only have 4).  The skill level is lost between each mission.And like many games, maps needs time to be understood because hunker in a building and defending is really difficult. Especially with the light system that influence the line of sight of the team and the accuracy for shooting enemies.So...This game is really good but really hard too with unfriendly players that doesn't give a sh... of what you say in game.It's a bit messy for now but with few updates... this is gonna be a gem !The Red Solstice is nice and needs to be played with friends.Alone you gonna hate it.So i recommand it for experienced player used to games really hardcore and ready to play with trusted fellow... for the others, wait a bit ^^.[Previous review: game not recommended]I was really disappointed. In the action you're just lost. You spend tons of time to search for gear in lockers. You always lack of something especially ammo. Shooting enemies is a pain in the♥♥♥♥♥especially due to the fact that firing in automatic mode is useless (automatic mode= your monkey see smtg he shoots. The problem, after 3 meters you miss all the time).The objectives are ♥♥♥♥ed up. In fact you spend so much time in gearing that you can't see what you have to do. There is no order in objectives or obvious triggers. You will have an AI which talks all the time and disturbs you by the same occasion.In general in the game is like that (when you are a medic like me):-Clicking all the time on the screen to move sucks...-Shotgun ammo allready depleeed ?-Where is that dude? His health is dropping too fast, stop running away from the team damm it !-Why are we scavenging? There is a mission to do!-This auto aim sucks.-Please AI, shut your damm mouth!-Oh no! I've spent points in the wrong skill section...-This player is a bas... i doesn't want to give me some ammo.-More monsters. Where do they come from?-Ok righ... thanks for stealing the ammo I need!-WTF ?! We haven't done the objectives and we have to evac?!-It's crowed out here... I hope I will keep theses meat bags alive without ammo.-What he is doing?! The damm VIP is running into the danger![Dead]-This boss sucks.-Thanks for the help guys![Disconnected]Sorry but for the moment we can't play correctly because there is no way to prepare the attack or talk in game. For a tactical game it's a bit difficult to accept.So actually all games i've played failed, even in easy mode.I tried to do my best as a medic but seriously it doesn't appeal to take the role of support in this game. It seems more efficient to kill everything...And the controls are bad, moving should be with the keyboard.There is a great potential but actually the game is unplayable.And if you don't like this review, well... thank you ! Because with your help other players will be completely wrong about this game.And it's not because of Early access. I've changed some of my reviews in front of the state of the game...

number of helpful: 6 of 15 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 13, 2014
Early Access Review
								July 4th 2015. This game is a peice of crap. If you are thinking about playing this game, realize that you will be playing it with yourself. Ive been checking it out on and off since day one, hoping that they will update or fix it, but half the time, the game wont even start.  (July 13, 2004)    State of the game; Promising, but unstable.   This game touches on alot of diffent genres, and alot of different gamers will find enjoyment in this game. Its a MOBA; Its an RTS (you must change tactics and think on the fly constantly); Its an RPG; Its got waves of monsters; It has persistant ranks and perks like some FPS games. Play this game if you are patient with in-development games. Dont play it if a graphical UI bug ruins the whole game for you.      At this point, I can play for several hours with only a few crashes. BUuuuut the game loads so fast, that Im back in a game lobby 8 seconds later.    Game Lobbies:    Need work; this is where the patience comes in. sometimes you roll into a generically named match, and get booted for no reason (actual reason being, there are no solo games YET. some people want to be alone)      When looking at the game lobby, think. pre-starcraft gamepy-battle.net Warcraft lobby. with some more serious UI graphical gliches. A friend of mine said half the game list was pinched into itself, so 10 games were jumbled into a single line. He couldnt see my game. Or the fun one where your mouse pointer selects things a full inch above it on the selection screen and you join the wrong game, get kicked, then the game you wanted is full and non-joinable.    These are things they will change, and shouldnt be taken into consideration, when summarizing this games overall quality.  Yes, it has gameplay bugs, yes it has balance issues, yes, you will die ALOT.... BUT. the players are helpful, the developers update biweekly it seems, AND Im going to go play it right now, Despite writing all this

content:
Posted: July 10, 2014
Early Access Review
								This tactical top-down 8 player co-op survival game can be unforgiving at times.  The random objectives & maps kept things fresh and unpredictable, though the difficulty is incredibly unbalanced in my opinion.  While matches supposedly can last up to an hour, I found myself dying within five minutes...mainly due to the "waves" growing in difficulty at a ridiculous rate.  Eight different classes and the ability to level up/gain xp help to make up for that, though.  It needs some more work (obviously), but I'd be interested to see how the final product looks once the game goes live.

content:
Posted: December 6, 2016
												This is a game I've come to really enjoy. Although singleplayer experiences are normally my thing, I couldn't bring myself to stick with this game's singleplayer campaign past completion of the first mission. However, the cooperative online mode is quite great. It's a bit tough, which is normally a turn-off for me, but the players in the online community are generally quite helpful and give lots of wonderful tips to success. I wouldn't call myself "good" at the game yet by any stretch of the word, but I know enough to be able to have fun and have a better idea of what's going on than I did when I started and was pretty clueless. The other players were really great despite my idiocy in this game.Long story short, you all drop down on a planet with funky zombie and xeno monsters, you have simple objectives without much going on plot-wise, and while you're running around completing objectives, the types of enemies are getting tougher and tougher. At first, you have time to get a lot done and try to gather up healing supplies and ammo, but later on, everything will be so hectic that you'll be trying to conserve ammo even more and things just keep getting more intense. Finally, if you live long enough, you can escape on a drop ship, and it feels pretty darn rewarding to survive when you're pretty new to the game. After each mission, you're awarded experience points which unlock skills and new classes, which is fun, though each mission often takes 45 minutes to an hour, so you do need a bit of time to play.Now comes the big downside to this game. It can be difficult to find people to play with. I've been online before in spurts of 5-10 minutes without a single game available to join, or a lobby trying to fill up desperately. It's quite sad because the game is fun, but it's not always reliable that you'll be able to play when you want to. I came very close to not recommending this game for this reason, but there are people who do play online, and I've had more times that people were online than weren't. With that in mind, I do recommend this game. I wish more folks played it, because it's different than many online cooperative games, and is a nice diamond in the rough.

content:
Posted: July 8, 2016
												I love story driven sp or coop campaigns with a rich backstory so I asked for a refund mid mission 2. There was an alien shooter long ago that did exactly this but was way more fun. If I could remember its name, I would have been playing that instead.Cons-The single-player campaign was horrendous. -I have to individually left click each enemy to attack when they spawn like crazy? No.-I have to right click and lift finger to move somewhere. I cant use wsad to move or keep the mouse clicked. No. Think of it in this way, Monster is coming, I have to move back or instantly change direction and also fire. In this game, I left click the monster, then right click a path. The tactical whatever to issue orders is nice but it adds complexity to something that should not be complex in the first place. It has been done properly before (If only I could remember that game's name).  Not worth the effort.-Cant see which doors are open or even if there is a door where you are facing. Developers must have noticed this as well since they implemented precise pathfinding. -Some kind of ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ flashlight would be nice on an elite commando squad leader. -There are random supply crates around but you get meh stuff for every 10-15 crates opened. The rest is empty.-My squad ai just sucks. I would presume in a virus infested world, you wouldn't be hugging the squad leader all the time unless he specifically orders you not to.-I turn on the ingame lights but everything is always so dark (Except for a few places). I play every game fine with my current monitor setting so I don't see why I have to change it just for this game.-An elite commando who has to shoot gas canisters and barrels 4-5 times so they explode...? No.-Enemies in the first 2 levels are just...*sigh*-I found a merc armor which lowered my hp. I have no idea what its supposed to add as stats.Pros-Whatever the upvoting guys wrote, I suppose. They appear to have loved multiplayer with some guy boasting 500h+. -Tactical whatever where you assign orders to each member.

												The story is ok but, your buying this for gameplay. Successful matches last between 20-50 minutes, all of it intense, squad coop, loot and run action. But don't worry about successes because your first game you will die, along with every game after until something clicks and you die less. Everyone has and that makes this game's community awesome. My first game was with a mix group of guys and we got picked off one by one.My Second game i stayed with the squad everything was fine and then everyone run out of ammo.My Third game was awesome, boss mobs, explosives, chainguns and flame weapons. we died.... my point - in all of them everyone said, GG and laughed about it.Must have for any die-hard space marine.Remember press "X" to drop ammo and "F" for flares.

Posted: December 23, 2016
												First singleplayer mission was the Dark Colony. Watched others play that mission and it was a normal sqaud mission with briefings and whatnot. Me, i had to defend a crossroad from waves of mobs no breifings no nothing. 4 doors/gates 4x10 wave of mobs, thats it. No story whatsoever just pure survival.I managed to complete this map after getting stuck inside a closed gate and wait for the mission timer to run out. Next mission wasnt mission #2 it was mission #7. Same thing.Devs, what the ♥♥♥♥ is wrong with you?Nice game though, got potential. Deeper RPG elements and world item construction would be grand. The barricades as is is a joke. If you build a barricade that thing should be there for a reason not just visual fluff mobs ignore. How about the ability to close off gates/doors, as a player, for a more tactical viability and immersion. Yeah the ability to setup a proper defense position...crazy ♥♥♥♥ing idea right.As it stands this game is a waste of time.

content:

												Things wrong with Red Solstice:1. poor mob AI2. Weak player dynamics and limited map expansion 3. 1 bland and boring map, no RNG or map rotation4. no gear  or loot farming5. Ethically challenged developers who may or may not have rigged their 1 tournament. 1 thru 4 is pretty standard for an indie team. I can forgive that, but compound 5 on the first 4, and we have a wasted potential.Go to Squad, or go to Serious Sam if you really want to support Croatia's IT industry. Nothing good came of this labor of love, and after all the goodwill that went into Red Solstice's kickstarter that is the real tragedy.

												Some of the best game time I've spent ever. Successor to WC3 and SC2 mod maps (NOTD), played some of those but find this to be more enjoyable and "easier". Learning Curve is still pretty steep though but once you've sussed out the maps and the wave timings and with a good group the gameplay is nice. Higher difficulties need communication via voice (anyone who says otherwise has probably never succeeded in playing harder difficulties) - so join the Official TS server (join.ts4gamer.com).The community is small, and yes, fairly exclusive but anyone who is willing to learn is more than welcomed into the "fold" so don't let the vets scare you. We're all just gunning for game wins :)Looking forward to TRS2!!!

number of helpful: 5 of 17 people (29%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 25
												Everything in this game is average at bestwin 10, 980Ti and i7 4770K and I don't have good fps, I turned off Vsynf to check if it will help, in some game this cause frame drops and low fps feel, but no. So I turned off couple more options to check if it help and in the end I turned off everything :) funny thing game didn't change all that much :P In the end this help a little but it is still not ideal.Another thing, preloading, this take forever! I turned it all off and this help a lot with level loading times. I don't know what is wrong with this, bad optimization? Oh did I mention that if you want to change any graphic options you will need to restart game in order to changes take effect? Very modern approach like in 1998 and only in some bad games :)Graphics is nothing special, so I don't know why fps is such a big problem, should wokr great even in smartphone :) Most levels are dark, uninspiring and not interesting, very repetitive and boring, all the same all the same. Animation are clunky and stiff. Endless waves of enemies is tedious and combat in tactical mode or not are not satisfying. Story is simple and just meh, I would be ok with this if any part of the game was actually good that I can enjoy but no, not even this :) Writing, dialogues, voice acting are like everything else, good thing you can skip all cut scenes :) Even in menu between missions where you can equip skills and weapons have low fps and hitboxes on buttons in menu or " how to play" part doesn't always work.If you shoot flare in the air outside buildings it can lighten up all buildings inside because why would anyone build roof in buildings right? crazy :P and if you move camera and shoot flare you can lighten up even other end of the map far faaar away from your character :)And there is more and more things like this.So if there is anything good in this game?in short: nolong version: noooooo :)

content:
Posted: October 27, 2014
Early Access Review
								Please take time to read this before you buy. I bought this game because I saw on Steam it had pretty good reviews and after watching some gameplay videos, I wanted to try it out. When I get into the game, the setting were not the optimal settings I wanted. I changed them and had to reset my game. I did that and now the mouse cursor was way off point. I decided to go on the discussion forums for this and see if anyone could help. When I did that, they had a section for bugs and other problems and they were LOADED with pages of bugs people were reporting. I understand it's still in the process of being made but wow, it was a lot. I posted about my problem. I even tried doing other things that people posted on different forums but nothing worked. The dev. replied back "You probably changed your resolution to bigger ratio your monitor doesn't support it, we'll be fixing this very soon. In the meantime go to users\local\theredsolstice and change settings.ini there to fix the problem." My resolution is set to my optimal screen resolution which is 1920x1080 so that can't be the problem. I tried another time going into the hard drive settings. It says 1280x720 and go into game and still 1920x1080. The game is unplayable for me. I feel like I lost $20. This is my first Steam review but I feel like this needed to be noted. If you're looking into buying this now, I'd wait till they seem to get everything under control.

												This game was made for ♥♥♥♥ing rats. It's a piece of♥♥♥♥♥♥ and only horses play it. I personally played a few minutes of this piece of♥♥♥♥♥♥game and met terrible stallions. One man didn't even know the lyrics to Allstar by my main man Smash Mouth. I swear, I have no idea why anybody is leaving positive reviews for this ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥looting simulator. I would recommend this game. Not to my friends, but to those I hate so that they have an incentive to kill themselves knowing that they own the game. I completely understand why this game was put on sale, it needed to do anything it could to attract players into the trap that is the pit in which the Sarlacc Pit Monster from Tatooine rests within. As someone who has played many "strategy" games, I can safely say this is not NOT a strategy game. It's a game made for you to blow your own brains out as you attempt to blow the brains out of the meaningless hordes of zombies and other creatures the game throws at you. I would rather sit in a lobby for CS:GO matchmaking for 14 hours than player another minute of this ♥♥♥♥♥♥, badly optimized, rat ♥♥♥♥ing game. In all honesty, my honest rating for the game would have to be:1,000,000 dead Han Solos/1. In other words, the worst possible game I could ever think of.

												EDIT:Ive given the game a bit of time now that its officially out. The single player campaign is decently fun, and the multiplayer now has a small amount of people playing. Getting a team together still can take some time, and often consists of people all different levels creating a very unbalanced game of noobs with vets.However, the gameplay is still fun if you enjoy the semi starcraft modded gameplay, and with decent people, its a very fun group game.Old Review:I want to like this game. I DO like this game. Its a good game. At least, the little bit of the single player prologue that I was able to play (which was all about 20 minutes). The rest of the game right now, is online only, and well, THERE IS NO ONE TO PLAY IT WITH.Ive sat in the lobby for hours with only 1-2 other afk people. NO ONE PLAYS THIS GAME. I WANT to play this game, but since its 100% reliant on having other people, Im unable to play it. I regret buying it not because its a bad game, but because I cant actually PLAY the game. Sigh.

								Awesome, yet challenging game. Teamwork is essential and if you get a well coordinated team together it's so much fun. Some people rate this game negative, I guess because of the difficulty. Those should probably stick to candy crush or farmville.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 5, 2014
												The Starcraft and Warcraft mods, are currently far better. Balance wise, and more. This has potential, but I don't think they will ever change it. Another note. Even after the fixes, there are certain bugs that still hit a large majority of people. I for instance, can play this game, and every once and a blue moon, all the models actually load in. But generally, I am shooting air. Several people in the gorup I play with, suffer this same issue. This was recently tested again. All of us, more than meet the minimum requirments. This game is just poorly optimized, as of yet. If this game ever fixes these major issues, it may be worth picking up.Update 8/3/2015:  While I haven't had a chance to play through to much of it, it has definitely improved on a lot of little things, which actually make a big difference. Better yet, the game is working, and most of the major compadability issues everyone I knew had for the entirety of the beta, are now fixed. As the game is now, I would definitely recomend it. If you like these types of games, you'll probably like this one.  Admitedly, there are a few things I prefer about the Starcraft and Warcraft maps, such as the recon and marksman class, but, overall, this is a nice new twist, and I've played the other maps to death.If you are worried about an unfinished game, have no worries. Everything felt rather complete, and the single player campaign is really well done, including having special features specifically made for the campaign alone that make the game something of a charm. Such as the tactical combat. An interface that slows down time, and allows you to control your entire squad individually. I was wondering how they were going to handle the lack of fellow players with AI, and they nailed it.  Truthfully, some of the people online in the community are a bit sour, but there are also some nice, friendly people, just looking to have fun. Also, probably one of the better games to play with a group of friends.

content:
Posted: November 2, 2014
												The game is very tactical, you need to work as a team (this however means it has the problem of random groups which could lead to nothing), it takes alot of planning and failing a few times over to learn what comes when, and what you need to be ready for.This game has so much going for it, except for how it's almost impossible to play without a full squad (8 players!) or at least play it well and without the issues of being overwhelmed.Then there is the problems that the mouse button does most of the work. Right click for moving and interacting, and aiming and left clicking for shooting (That is unless you want a random auto-fire mode to do all the work, LOWER the damage, WASTE ammo and MISS targets in the dark) While the Left hand can move the camera (Optional) and mess around with inventory that barely is needed, except for when it's mandatory like boss battles where you may as well don't shoot and surrender if you don't have any explosives, damn sad.And before leaving the aiming, you don't aim at the curseor, you aim slightly below to the side where a red dot is where you have to keep track of, so much easier than keeping track of the cursor damnit!
